fullText: This is theater at its most experimental and unsettling, a production that lingers in your mind long after you leave the Hayes Theater.
dtliExcerpt: This is theater at its most experimental and unsettling, a production that lingers in your mind long after you leave the Hayes Theater.
bwwExcerpt: It is not just lip-syncing, though, which implies a very basic act of impersonation or mimicry. For one, O'Connell masters every rustle, movement of the body, caught breath, laugh, rise of emotion. Every sound that is on tape, every pause, everything is replicated by her. But she also inhabits the character of Higginbotham commandingly too, sitting there, facing us.
